com.compendium.ui.dialogs
Class UIDatabaseManagementDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      com.compendium.ui.dialogs.UIDialog
                          com.compendium.ui.dialogs.UIDatabaseManagementDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBProgressListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class UIDatabaseManagementDialog
extends UIDialog
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, DBProgressListener

This dialog allows the user to select a current database and copy it to another named database

Author:
Michelle Bachler
See Also:

Constructor Detail

UIDatabaseManagementDialog

public UIDatabaseManagementDialog(javax.swing.JFrame parent,
                                  DBAdminDatabase admin,
                                  java.lang.String sMySQLName,
                                  java.lang.String sMySQLPassword,
                                  java.lang.String sMySQLIP)
Constructor use when backup code called direct from Menu without displaying this dialog.

Parameters:
parent, - the parent frame to this dailog.
admin - com.compendium.core.db.management.DBAdminDatabase, the class required to perform database administration tasks.
sMySQLName, - the login name to use when connection to MySQL.
sMySQLPassword, - the password to use when connection to MySQL.
sMySQLIP, - the ip address or hostname to use to connect to MySQL.

UIDatabaseManagementDialog

public UIDatabaseManagementDialog(javax.swing.JFrame parent,
                                  DBAdminDatabase admin,
                                  java.util.Vector projects,
                                  java.lang.String sMySQLName,
                                  java.lang.String sMySQLPassword,
                                  java.lang.String sMySQLIP)
Constructor for standard Project Managment dialog.

Parameters:
parent - the parent frame to this dialog.
htProjectCheck - used to check the status of the project schema and display info in list.
admin - the class required to perform database administration tasks.
projects - the list of existing MySQL database projects.
sMySQLName - the login name to use when connection to MySQL.
sMySQLPassword - the password to use when connection to MySQL.
sMySQLIP - the ip address or hostname to use to connect to MySQL.

onBackup

public void onBackup(java.lang.String sFriendlyName,
                     java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                     int nResumeAction,
                     boolean bCloseAfter)
Backup the database with the given database name

Parameters:
String - sFriendlyName, the name the user chooses
String - sDatabaseName, the actual name of the database (after the users chosen name has been 'cleaned' and dated)
int - resumeAction (if backup was called from 'Delete' or 'Restore To', action to resume after backup (thread syn issue).
boolean - bCloseAfter, should this dialog be closed when the action is complete.

onBackupPlain

public void onBackupPlain(java.lang.String sFriendlyName,
                          java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                          int nResumeAction,
                          boolean bCloseAfter)
Backup the database with the given database name

Parameters:
String - sFriendlyName, the name the user chooses
String - sDatabaseName, the actual name of the database (after the users chosen name has been 'cleaned' and dated)
int - resumeAction (if backup was called from 'Delete' or 'Restore To', action to resume after backup (thread syn issue).
boolean - bCloseAfter, should this dialog be closed when the action is complete.

public void onBackupZip(java.lang.String sFriendlyName,

                        int nResumeAction,
                        boolean bKeepPaths,
                        boolean bCloseAfter,
                        boolean bIncludeMovies,
                        boolean bIncludeTemplates,
                        boolean bIncludeTrash)
Backup the database with the given database name and all associated resources.

Parameters:
sFriendlyName, - the user assigned name for the selected database project to backup.
sDatabaseName, - the system assigned name for the selected database project to backup.
int - resumeAction (if backup was called from 'Delete' or 'Restore To', action to resume after backup (thread syn issue).
boolean - bCloseAfter, should this dialog be closed when the action is complete.

Parameters:
sFriendlyName, - the user assigned name for the selected database project to restore over.
sDatabaseName, - the system assigned name for the selected database project to restore over.
bHasBackedUp, - has the user backed up this database before doing the restore?

Parameters:
sFriendlyName, - the user assigned name for the selected database project to delete.
sDatabaseName, - the system assigned name for the selected database project to delete.
bHasBackedUp, - has the user backuped up the data before doing this delete?
